page.title: 14"Bowcombe"-Transport Changes
page.content: Several of the older inhabitants remember when the first car came to the area. One man remembers quite clearly that it was a Model T Ford. "The second was a bull-nosed Morris. Then there was a third and everybody was terrified that there would be a collision!" That was 50 years ago. Now everybody has a car. It is no longer a luxury. The private car has multiplied at the expense of public transport. There is just one bus service through the area, which is mainly used by tourists. On the land, four wheel drive vehicles, tractors, and combine harvesters, and lately, more speciallised vehicles such as motor tricycles, have replaced the old horse drawn wagons, stationary steam engines, and threshers.
